key_work.title: Letters to Arralla
key_work.credit_line:
Key art, concept art & stills from Letters to Arralla

Little Pink Clouds, Australia, 2024

Courtesy Little Pink Clouds
key_work.brief_description:
Letters to Arralla takes players to a whimsical island with pink skies, rolling hills and fruit n’ veggie villagers. As a mail delivery-turnip, players can explore the island, help neighbours and snoop into their business by reading their mail.

Letters to Arralla presents a cheeky dreamworld inspired by wistful memories of childhood imagination. Its charming playscape and soft plush characters cherish an idyllic form of traditional ‘adorable’ femininity. ‘Cosy’ and ‘wholesome’ indie games have flourished in recent years. They offer a refreshing take on videogame conventions and appeal to players who don’t want violence and competition and instead value gentle interactions and positive game worlds. This game reproduces the soft, warm textures reminiscent of the comfort of a beloved stuffed toy.

Letters to Arralla is currently under development and is supported by VicScreen.

key_work.title: My Dream PC
key_work.credit_line:
Key art, concept art & stills from My Dream PC

CODE RMIT, Australia 2025

Courtesy CODE RMIT
key_work.brief_description:
My Dream PC celebrates the women who build personal computers (PC) and prove that femininity and technical competency are complementary.

Inspired by feminine internet trends like ‘cottagecore’, players can use flowers, furniture and magic to design their own PC. Through the visual language of dollhouses and everyday objects, My Dream PC challenges the masculine, utilitarian image of the computer.

Computers are often linked to function and rationality; design principles that contrast with feminine stereotypes like decoration and sentimentality, and Apple’s virtual assistant Siri. By embracing hyper-femininity, My Dream PC celebrates the craft, tech-competency and creativity of women PC builders around the world.

key_work.title: Mystiques
key_work.credit_line:
Key art, concept art & stills from Mystiques

Lemonade Games, Australia, 2025

Courtesy Lemonade Games
key_work.brief_description:
Mystiques is a haunted antiquing game about four chaotic women who turn to psychic powers to save their failing shop. Inspired by the quirky antique stores in the Blue Mountains and internet-famous grifters like Anna Delvey and Elizabeth Holmes, Mystiques is both a whimsical paranormal adventure and a girlcore inventory game.

To keep the store alive, players rummage through the belongings of the recently deceased, bargaining with spirits to find the most valuable relics to sell. Lemonade Games’ debut mixes spooky adventure with vintage flair, echoing films like Suspiria (1977) and Jennifer’s Body (2009). It’s about making money, dealing with ghosts, and maybe texting your ex (though probably not a great idea).

Mystiques is supported by Screen Australia and is currently under development.

start.credit_line:
Key art, concept art & stills from Mystiques

Lemonade Games, Australia, 2025

Courtesy Lemonade Games
start.brief_description:
Mystiques is a haunted antiquing game about four chaotic women who turn to psychic powers to save their failing shop. Inspired by the quirky antique stores in the Blue Mountains and internet-famous grifters like Anna Delvey and Elizabeth Holmes, Mystiques is both a whimsical paranormal adventure and a girlcore inventory game.

To keep the store alive, players rummage through the belongings of the recently deceased, bargaining with spirits to find the most valuable relics to sell. Lemonade Games’ debut mixes spooky adventure with vintage flair, echoing films like Suspiria (1977) and Jennifer’s Body (2009). It’s about making money, dealing with ghosts, and maybe texting your ex (though probably not a great idea).

Mystiques is supported by Screen Australia and is currently under development.

links.description: One of the key inspirations behind the tone, humor and aesthetics of Mystiques is the film Jennifer’s Body. A memorable prop from this film is Jennifer’s heart-shaped BFF necklace, which signifies the toxic friendship between the two protagonists.

key_work.title: Kamata
key_work.credit_line:
Key art, concept art & stills from Kamata

STEMtoto Studio, Australia, 2025

Courtesy STEMtoto Studio
key_work.brief_description:
Clean up the vibrant island of Zimzemba as a young girl named Nia, uncovering its natural beauty and those responsible for its pollution.

Society tends to hold young girls as symbols of morality and hope for the future. While activists like Greta Thunberg are highly visible, Kamata amplifies the voices of young African girls, who often lack representation in videogames and on the political stage.

The game offers an Afrofeminist critique of the imbalances of responsibility and power between young African girls, their community, and the corporations whose ecological footprint threatens to compromise their future.

Developers STEMtoto (‘Mtoto’ is a Swahili term for ‘child’) develop games for future learning, and cultural and ecological regeneration.

Kamata is currently under development.

start.brief_description: After a global war, the seaside kingdom known as the Valley of the Wind remains one of the last strongholds on Earth untouched by a poisonous jungle and the powerful insects that guard it. Led by the courageous Princess Nausicaä, the people of the Valley engage in an epic struggle to restore the bond between humanity and Earth.
